summary: The 'Upholding a Secure Postal System Act' mandates the Comptroller General of the United States to produce annual reports to Congress for five years. These reports will investigate nationwide patterns of mail theft, delays, Postal Service employee violations, other criminal or civil violations under the Postal Inspection Service's jurisdiction, and theft or vandalism of Postal Service property. The reports will include descriptions of the Postal Service's current measures and recommendations for Congress and the Postal Service on addressing these issues. Consultation with the Inspector General and the Postal Inspection Service is also required.
